required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of CN202 in Adult Subjects With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumors or Hematologic Malignancies
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Multi-center, Phase I/II Study of CN202 in Adult Subjects With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumors or Hematologic Malignancies

brief_summary.textblock: The study is designed to evaluate the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetic characteristics and anti-tumor activity of CN202 in adult subjects with locally advanced or metastatic solid tumor or hematologic malignancies

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a multi-centre, open-label, Phase I/II study in adult subjects with locally advanced or metastatic solid tumor or hematologic malignancies.
The study consists of three parts
Phase Ia: Dose Escalation: This is a dose escalation for assessment of dose-limiting toxicities (DLT) at approximately four dose levels in subjects with locally advanced or metastatic solid tumor or hematologic malignancies.
Phase Ib: Dose Expansion: To evaluate the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics, and preliminary efficacy of CN202, prior to determination of Maximum tolerated dose (MTD)
Phase II: To further evaluate the safety, tolerance, pharmacokinetic characteristics, and anti-tumor activity of CN202 in subjects with select tumors. All subjects will receive the recommended Phase II dose of CN202.
There will be 13 to 24 subjects enrolled in phase Ia, 12 to 40 subjects in phase Ib and 15 to 100 subjects in phase II

primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the safety and tolerability of CN202 administered to subjects with locally advanced or metastatic solid tumor or hematologic malignancies through adverse events as assessed by NCI-CTCAE v5.0
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements at Baseline till 90 days after the last dose of study drug
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with treatment related adverse events as assessed by NCI-CTCAE v5.0

primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the dose-limiting toxicity (DLT) and to determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) of CN202 when administered as a single-agent to subjects
primary_outcome.time_frame: DLT assessed within 21 days after the first dose of CN202
primary_outcome.description: Measured by Incidence of dose limiting toxicities (DLT) during the first cycle of treatment and DLT observation period

primary_outcome.measure: To identify a recommended Phase II dose (RP2D) of CN202
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to End of the Treatment assessed up to an average of 24 months
primary_outcome.description: The recommended Phase II dose (RP2D) will be determined based on safety, efficacy, pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamic date of CN202

primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the anti-tumor activity of CN202 in selected solid tumors or hematologic malignancies as determined by Objective Response Rate (ORR)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to End of the Treatment assessed up to an average of 24 months

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the safety and tolerability of CN202 administered to subjects with locally advanced or metastatic solid tumor or hematologic malignancies through Electrocardiogram (ECG)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to End of the Treatment assessed up to an average of 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by ECG as assessed by the P wave, the QRS complex, and T wave

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the safety and tolerability of CN202 administered to subjects with locally advanced or metastatic solid tumor or hematologic malignancies through vital signs as assessed by heart rate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to End of the Treatment assessed up to an average of 24 months

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the safety and tolerability of CN202 administered to subjects with locally advanced or metastatic solid tumor or hematologic malignancies through vital signs as assessed by body temperature
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to End of the Treatment assessed up to an average of 24 months

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the safety and tolerability of CN202 administered to subjects with locally advanced or metastatic solid tumor or hematologic malignancies through vital signs as assessed by pulse, systolic blood pressure, and diastolic blood pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to End of the Treatment assessed up to an average of 24 months

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the safety and tolerability of CN202 administered to subjects with locally advanced or metastatic solid tumor or hematologic malignancies through vital signs as assessed by respiratory rate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to End of the Treatment assessed up to an average of 24 months

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the pharmacokinetic (PK) of CN202 when administered to subjects with locally advanced or metastatic solid tumor or hematologic malignancies
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to End of the Treatment assessed up to an average of 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: The following parameter is used for evaluation during PK assessments: maximum concentration (Cmax)

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the pharmacokinetic (PK) of CN202 when administered to subjects with locally advanced or metastatic solid tumor or hematologic malignancies
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to End of the Treatment assessed up to an average of 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: The following parameter is used for evaluation during PK assessments: area under the concentration-time curve (AUC)

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the pharmacokinetic (PK) of CN202 when administered to subjects with locally advanced or metastatic solid tumor or hematologic malignancies
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to End of the Treatment assessed up to an average of 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: The following parameter is used for evaluation during PK assessments: half-life (t½)

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess the immunogenic potential of CN202 by measuring anti-CN202 antibodies through Immunogenicity analysis test results
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to End of the Treatment assessed up to an average of 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Measured through immunogenicity analysis test results (anti-drug antibodies and Neutralizing antibodies) and days from first dosing to positive result of anti-drug antibodies (ADA) or Neutralizing antibodies (NAb)

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess the pharmacodynamic (PD) of CN202 when administered to subjects with locally advanced or metastatic solid tumor or hematologic malignancies
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to End of the Treatment assessed up to an average of 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: The pharmacodynamic profile assessed based on the analysis of PD-L1 receptor occupancy (RO) and biomarkers in peripheral blood and tumor tissues

arm_group.description: Four planned CN202 dose level of 1 mg/kg, 3 mg/kg, 10 mg/kg, 20 mg/kg Subjects will receive CN202 by intravenous infusion (IV) on Day 1 of each cycle (once every 2 weeks) for up to 24 months

intervention.description: Participants will receive CN202 by IV infusion on Day 1 of each cycle (once every 2 weeks). The 4 planned dose levels are 1 mg/kg, 3 mg/kg, 10 mg/kg, 20 mg/kg
